feat.name: Scion of Domora Dedication
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Familiar Master Dedication|APG}, you have befriended a spirit guide and it bonded with you using its Bond with Mortal ability.
entries: You gain a spirit guide ally. Your familiar takes on the form of a {@familiar spirit guide|GW2} specific familiar.
special: You can take Scion of Domora Dedication even if you have the {@feat Familiar Master Dedication|APG} and have not taken two other {@archetype Familiar Master|APG} feats. You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained at least two other feats from the {@archetype scion of Domora|GW2} or {@archetype familiar master|APG} archetypes.

feat.name: Guided Skill
entries: You ask your spirit guide for aid. For the next 10 minutes, you gain a +2 status bonus to checks made using {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Occultism}, {@skill Stealth}, or {@skill Survival}.

feat.name: Spiritual Strike
feat.requirements: You are wielding a weapon with at least one fundamental rune and your familiar is adjacent to you or in your space.
entries: Your spirit guide enhances your attacks with occult power. Make a {@action Strike} with a weapon that has at least one fundamental rune. This counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty. The {@action Strike} has the effects of the {@item ghost touch} property rune and deals an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage. If your weapon has a {@item major striking} rune, this {@action Strike} instead deals {@damage 3d6} force damage.

feat.name: Guardian's Embrace
feat.requirements: You are adjacent to your spirit guide or it is sharing your space.
entries: Your spirit guide discorporates to surround you in an invisible protective shroud. You gain a +2 status bonus to AC against physical attacks until the beginning of your next turn. If you are hit by a physical attack during this time, you can use a reaction to gain resistance 10 to physical damage dealt by that attack; doing so ends the AC bonus, and you can't use Guardian's Embrace again for 10 minutes. Your spirit guide cannot be targeted by effects, cannot be affected by area effects, and cannot take any actions while this ability is active. Your spirit guide appears in a space adjacent to you when the effect ends.

feat.name: Invigorating Breath
feat.requirements: You are adjacent to your spirit guide or it is sharing your space.
entries: Your spirit guide exhales its sweet-smelling breath on you, granting you the strength to push through your pain. You gain 20 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes. At 15th level, you instead gain 30 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes.

feat.name: Spiritual Flurry
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Scion of Domora Dedication|GW2}, {@feat Spiritual Strike|GW2}
entries: When you use Spiritual {@action Strike}, hit targets become {@condition flat-footed} until the end of your current turn. In addition, the additional force damage dealt by the {@action Strike} increases by {@dice 2d6}.

feat.name: Spiritual Aid
entries: When you call your spirit guide for aid, its presence bolsters your will and agility. You gain the Spiritual {@action Aid} reaction.

entries.name: Spiritual Aid
entries.trigger: You fail a Reflex or Will saving throw
entries: You reroll the triggering saving throw. You must use the second result, even if it's worse. If you roll a success, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Spirit Guide Form
entries: You fuse with your spirit guide, becoming a hybrid being with enhanced physical and spiritual power. This effect lasts 1 minute; you can end it early as a free action. During this time, you can't use any other actions granted by this archetype.
You gain the following statistics and abilities, regardless of your type of spirit guide.

items: You gain resistance 10 to all damage (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical).

An {@trait unarmed} melee attack of the same type as your spirit guide (either claws or jaws), which is the only attack you can {@action Strike} with. You're trained with this attack. Your attack modifier is {@hit +29} or your normal unarmed attack modifier, whichever is higher. You use the listed statistics for the unarmed attack type:
{@b Claws} ({@trait agile}, {@trait backstabber}, {@trait finesse}) {@as 1} {@b Damage} {@damage 3d6+5} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} force
{@b Jaws} ({@trait forceful}) {@as 1} {@b Damage} {@damage 3d10+5} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} force.
